intro: Hippocrepis multisiliquosa var. major, commonly known as the large-flowered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while its fruit is a long, slender silique containing several seeds. This variety is distinguished by its larger flowers and more robust growth compared to other varieties of the species.
